1.text: And it will be when Samuel was old, he set his sons judges to Israel.

2.text: And the name of his son the firstborn will be Joel; and the name of his second, Abiah: judges at the Well of the Oath.

3.text: And his sons went not in his way, and they will incline after plunder, and they will take a gift, and they will turn away from judgment.

4.text: And all the old men of Israel will gather together and will come to Samuel to Ramah;

5.text: And they will say to him, Behold, thou wert old, and thy sons went not in thy ways: now set up for us a king to judge us as all the nations.

6.text: And the word will be evil in the eyes of Samuel when they said, Give to us a king to judge us: and Samuel will pray to Jehovah.

7.text: And Jehovah will say to Samuel, Hear to the voice of the people to all which they will say to thee: for not thee did they reject, but me they rejected from reigning over them.

8.text: According to all the works which they did from the day I brought them up out of Egypt, and even to this day, and they will forsake me and serve other gods, so they do also to thee.

9.text: And now hear to their voice: but protesting, thou shalt protest to them, and announce to them the judgment of the king who shall reign over them.

10.text: And Samuel will say all the words of Jehovah to the people asking from him a king.

11.text: And he will say, This shall be the judgment of the king who shall reign over you: your sons he will take and set for himself, for his chariots and for his horsemen; and running before his chariots.

12.text: And to set to himself captains of thousands and captains of fifties; and to plough his ploughing and to reap his harvest, and to do all his fighting and all his chariots.

13.text: And your daughters he will take for perfumers, and for cooks, and for bakers.

14.text: And your fields and your vineyards, and your olive trees, the good he will take and give to his servants.

15.text: And of your seeds and of your vineyards he will take the tenth and give to his eunuchs and to his servants.

16.text: And your servants and your maids, and your good young men, and your asses, he will take and make for his services.

17.text: And of your sheep he will take the tenth: and ye shall be to him for servants.

18.text: And ye cried out in that day from before your king which ye chose to yourselves; and Jehovah will not answer you in that day.

19.text: And the people will refuse to hear to the voice of Samuel; and they will say, Nay; but a king shall be over us.

20.text: And we were as all the nations; and our king judged us and went out before us, and fought our battles.

21.text: And Samuel will hear all the words of the people, and he will speak them in the ears of Jehovah.

22.text: And Jehovah will say to Samuel, Hear to their voice, and make a king for them. And Samuel will say to them, Go ye a man to his city.
